column6: Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target.
Has a ~10% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.
Has a high critical hit ratio.
Raises the user's Speed by 2 stages.
Raises the user's Special Defense by 2 stages.
Has a ~10% chance to raise all of the user's stats by 1 stage.
Infatuates Pokemon of the opposite gender, even if they have a Substitute, causing a 50% chance for the target's attack to fail.
Has a ~10% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.
Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

The user returns to its party, bypassing any trapping moves and Pursuit; it passes all stat modifiers (positive or negative), as well as confusion, Focus Energy, Perish Song count, Mist, Leech Seed, Ghost Curses, Mind Reader, Lock-On, Mean Look, Spider Web and Substitute to the replacement Pokemon. In-game, Baton Pass also passes partial trapping moves (Bind, Clamp, Fire Spin and Wrap), Foresight, Toxic if the replacement is poisoned and Nightmare if replacement is asleep.
Each healthy (i.e. not fainted nor inflicted with a status condition) Pokemon in your party contributes a typeless 10 base power hit determined solely by their base Attack and Defense stats.
The user maximizes its Attack but sacrifices 50% of its max HP.
The user absorbs all damage for 2-3 turns and then inflicts twice the absorbed damage on its target. This move ignores the target's type but still cannot hit Ghost-type Pokemon.
Traps the target for 2-5 turns, causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass.
Has a ~30% chance to make the target flinch.
Has a ~10% chance to freeze the target.
Has a ~30% chance to paralyze the target.
Has a ~10% chance to make the target flinch.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.
Strikes twice; if the first hit breaks the target's Substitute, the real Pokemon will take damage from the second hit.
Has a ~10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Traps the target for 2-5 turns, causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.
Confuses the target.
Has a ~10% chance to confuse the target.
Has a ~10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
The user's type changes to match the type of one of its four attacks. This move fails if the user cannot change its type under this condition.
The user's type changes to one that resists the type of the last attack that hit the user.
Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.
Almost always goes last; if an opponent strikes with a Physical attack before the user's turn, the user retaliates for twice the damage it had endured.
Has a high critical hit ratio.
Has a high critical hit ratio.
Has a ~20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

When used by a Ghost-type, the user sacrifices half of its max HP to sap the target by 1/4 of its max HP per turn. When used by anything else, the user's Speed is decreased by 1 stage and its Attack and Defense are increased by 1 stage.
Damages the target.
Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage; after one use of this move, the user's starting base power is doubled for every use of Rollout.
Causes an opponent to faint if its next attack KOs the user.
Almost always goes first. The user is protected from all attacks for one turn, but the move's success rate halves with each consecutive use of Protect, Detect or Endure.

On the first turn, the user digs underground, becoming uncontrollable, and evades all attacks. Earthquake, Magnitude and Fissure can hit underground, with Earthquake and Magnitude having doubled power; the user may also be hit underground if it was previously targeted by Lock-On or Mind Reader. On the second turn, the user attacks.

The target cannot choose its last move for 2-5 turns. Disable only works on one move at a time and fails if the target has not yet used a move or if its move has run out of PP. The target does nothing if it is about to use a move that becomes disabled.
Has a ~20% chance to confuse the target.
Strikes twice; if the first hit breaks the target's Substitute, the real Pokemon will take damage from the second hit.
Raises the user's Evasion by 1 stage.
The user receives 1/4 recoil damage.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.
Always deals 40 points of damage.
Has a ~30% chance to paralyze the target.
Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target but only works on a sleeping target.
Damages the target.
Confuses the target.
Power doubles when performed against Pokemon using Dig.
Damages the target.
Has a ~10% chance to burn the target.
The target is forced to use its last attack for the next 2-6 turns. The effects of this move will end immediately if the target runs out of PP for the repeated attack.
Almost always goes first. The user is left with at least 1 HP following any attacks for one turn, but the move's success rate halves with each consecutive use of Protect, Detect or Endure.
The Defense stat of other Pokemon is halved against this attack, essentially doubling the move's base power; causes the user to faint.
Usually goes first.
Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect, Detect or a target in the middle of Dig or Fly.
Leaves the target with at least 1 HP.
Has a ~10% chance to burn the target.

Traps the target for 2-5 turns, causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass.
The target faints; doesn't work on higher-leveled Pokemon. However, this move will hit Digging Pokemon.
Base power increases as the user's HP decreases.
Has a ~10% chance to burn the target; can be used while frozen, which both attacks the target normally and thaws the user.
Has a ~10% chance to burn the target.
Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

On the first turn, the user flies into the air, becoming uncontrollable, and evades most attacks. Gust, Twister and Thunder have normal accuracy against a mid-air Pokemon, with Gust and Twister also gaining doubled power. The user may also be hit in mid-air if it was previously targeted by Lock-On or Mind Reader. On the second turn, the user attacks.
Raises the user's chance for a critical hit by one domain.

Until the target faints or switches, the user's Accuracy modifiers and the target's Evasion modifiers are ignored. Ghost-type targets also lose their immunities against Normal-type and Fighting-type moves.
Power increases as user's happiness decreases; maximum 102 BP.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.

The base power of this move doubles with each consecutive hit; however, power is capped at a maximum 160 BP and remains there for any subsequent uses. If this move misses, or if the user selects another move, base power will be reset to 10 BP on the next turn.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.

This move, even if the user and/or the target switch out, will strike the active target at the end of the second turn after its use. This move cannot cause a critical hit and its damage is calculated by using the original user's Special Attack and the original target's Special Defense. The move's damage is typeless so it never receives STAB and ignores weaknesses, resistances and immunities against this move's type. Only one instance of Future Sight may be active at a time; because it occurs at the end of the round, it also hits through Protect, Detect and Endure.
Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target.
Paralyzes the target.
Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.

Eliminates any stat modifiers from all active Pokemon.
Has a ~30% chance to make the target flinch.
Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of status conditions.
If this attack misses the target, the user receives 1/8 recoil damage of what it would have inflicted.
Varies in power and type depending on the user's DVs; maximum 70 BP. Will run off the user's Attack or Special Attack depending on type.
Damages the target.

Lowers the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Has a ~30% chance to paralyze the target.
All Pokemon in the user's party receive 1/2 damage from Special attacks for 5 turns.

This move ensures that the user's next attack will hit against its current target. Even if the user switches out, its replacement's next move will always hit too. Lock-On fails against Pokemon in the middle of using Protect, Detect, Dig or Fly, as well as Pokemon behind a Substitute.
Puts the target to sleep.
Has a ~30% chance to make the target flinch.
Usually goes first.
Deals variable damage, between 10 base power and 130 base power, as well as double damage against Digging Pokemon.
As long as the user remains in battle, the target cannot switch out unless it uses Baton Pass. The target will still be trapped if the user switches out by using Baton Pass.

Damages the target.

The user performs a randomly selected move; almost any move in the game could be picked. Metronome cannot generate itself, Sketch, Struggle or any move that the user already knows.
Restores 1/2 of the user's max HP.

This move is temporarily replaced by the target's last move; the replacement move will have 5 PP and become part of the user's moveset until the user switches out or the battle ends. Mimic copies attacks even if they miss or the user has immunity toward their type; it cannot copy itself, Struggle, Transform, Sketch, Metronome or moves that the user already knows, and it will fail if the target has yet to use a move.

This move ensures that the user's next attack will hit against its current target. Even if the user switches out, its replacement's next move will always hit too. Mind Reader fails against Pokemon in the middle of using Protect, Detect, Dig or Fly, as well as Pokemon behind a Substitute.
Raises the user's Evasion by 1 stage; however, Stomp retains its normal accuracy and gains doubled power against Minimized Pokemon.
Almost always goes last; if an opponent strikes with a Special attack before the user's turn, the user retaliates for twice the damage it had endured.

The user performs the last move executed by its target; if applicable, an attack's damage is calculated with the user's stats, level and type(s). This moves fails if the target has not yet used a move. Mirror Move cannot copy itself, Metronome, Mimic, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Transform or moves that user already knows.

Protects the user from negative stat modifiers caused by other Pokemon, but not by itself, until it switches out; can be Baton Passed by user. The user's Accuracy and Evasion stats are also protected. Moves that cause negative stat modifiers as a secondary effect, such as Psychic, still deal their regular damage.

The user recovers 1/4 of its max HP during the morning or day and 1/2 of its max HP during the night. For all three time periods, healing is doubled during Sunny Day and halved during Rain Dance and Sandstorm.

The user recovers 1/4 of its max HP during the day or night and 1/2 of its max HP during the morning. For all three time periods, healing is doubled during Sunny Day and halved during Rain Dance and Sandstorm.
Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.
Does damage equal to user's level.
This move only works on a sleeping target; as long as the target remains asleep and in battle, 1/4 of its max HP is sapped after each turn.
Has a ~50% chance to lower the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.
The user attacks uncontrollably for 2-3 turns and then gets confused.
Calculates the average of the user's current HP and the target's HP; the HP of both Pokemon is set to this average.

The player picks up extra money after in-game battles; the money received is equal to: [user's level * 2 * number of times Pay Day is used]. The player does not lose money if the opponent uses Pay Day but the player wins the battle.
Damages the target.
All active Pokemon will faint in 3 turns unless they are switched out.

If the target switches out on the current turn, this move strikes with doubled power before the switch. Baton Passers still escape safely.
Usually goes first.
The user's Attack rises by 1 stage if attacked before its next move.

Cancels all other weather moves. For 5 turns: the power of Water attacks is increased by 50%, the power of Fire attacks is decreased by 50%, Thunder becomes 100% accurate, the power of Solarbeam is halved, and the healing power of Morning Sun, Synthesis and Moonlight is halved.

Removes Spikes and Leech Seed from the user's side of the field; also frees the user from Bind, Clamp, Fire Spin, Whirlpool and Wrap. These side effects do not occur if the move misses or is used against Ghost-type Pokemon.
Has a high critical hit ratio.
The user prepares on turn one, becoming uncontrollable, and then attacks on turn two. Has a high critical hit ratio.

The user permanently replaces Sketch with the last move used by the target. Sketch cannot copy itself, Explosion, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Selfdestruct, Sleep Talk, Struggle or Transform. This move fails automatically when selected in link battles.
The user prepares on turn one, raising its Defense by 1 stage and becoming uncontrollable, and then attacks on turn two.
The user prepares on turn one, becoming uncontrollable, and then attacks on turn two.

Puts the target to sleep.

Does nothing if the user is awake. If the user asleep, it randomly performs one of its attacks. If Rest is selected, user recovers its HP and stays asleep for two more turns. Sleep Talk can choose an attack that has run out of PP; the generated attacks also do not cost PP, and it cannot generate itself, Bide, Disabled attacks or two-turn attacks with a charge-up turn like Fly or Skull Bash. (Moves with a recharge turn like Hyper Beam can be generated.)

The user prepares on turn one, becoming uncontrollable, and then attacks on turn two. During Sunny Day, this move fires immediately; during Rain Dance, this move has half power.

As long as the user remains in battle, the target cannot switch out unless it uses Baton Pass. The target will still be trapped if the user switches out by using Baton Pass.

Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute, the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice, a 3/8 chance to hit three times, a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times.
Damages opponents, unless they are Flying-type, every time they are switched in; saps 1/8 of the opponent's max HP.
The target's most recent move is reduced by 2-5 PP; this fails if the target has not yet performed a move, if the target's last move has run out of PP, or if the target can only use Struggle.

Used automatically when all of the user's other moves have run out of PP or are otherwise inaccessible. The user receives 1/4 recoil damage. Struggle is classified as a typeless move and will hit any Pokemon, including Rock-, Steel- and Ghost-type Pokemon, for normal damage.
Paralyzes the target.
The user receives 1/4 recoil damage.

The user takes one-fourth of its maximum HP to create a substitute; this move fails if the user does not have enough HP for this. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat modifiers caused by other Pokemon. The user is still affected by Sandstorm and Attract from behind its Substitute. If a Substitute breaks from a hit during a multistrike move such as Fury Attack, the user takes damage from the remaining strikes.

Cancels all other weather moves. For 5 turns: freezing is prevented, the power of Fire attacks is increased by 50%, the power of Water attacks is decreased by 50%, Solarbeam fires immediately, Thunder becomes 50% accurate, and the healing power of Morning Sun, Synthesis and Moonlight is doubled.

The user morphs into a near-exact copy of the target. Stats, stat modifiers, type, moves, Hidden Power data and appearance are changed; the user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP. (If Transform is used by Ditto, the effects of Metal Powder stop working after transformation.)
Has a ~20% chance to burn, paralyze or freeze the target.

Attacks three times in one turn, adding 10 BP for each kick. If a kick misses, the move ends instantly; if one of the kicks breaks a target's Substitute, the real Pokemon will take damage for the remaining kicks.
